The NHS has staff and leaders with the drive and dedication to provide the very best care.

Hundreds of local people have offered to host Ukrainian refugees. At the peak of the Syrian conflict, Wandsworth Council only rehoused 12 families.

That’s why @WandswrthLabour are pledging to make a new Council Dept to help resettle people fleeing war.

 https://t.co/OKbvsu748e

@leeanntb @OWandsworth @jackamayorcas @KateForbes89 @LizzyDobres @Sarmila_V @JudiG @BeeKemiA @LondonLabour @MarshadeCordova @PutneyFleur @SadiqKhan I’m no one’s dog. What a nasty thing to say. I’ll block you now. Thanks.

🏡 1,000 new council homes

🧾 Same low Council Tax

From today, the Government is making calories on menus mandatory in England.

This will have a serious impact on people living with eating disorders. We urged the Government to consult with eating disorder experts and listen to people with lived experiences. They refused.

Popping this on here for anyone who needs a little positivi-tea today. Keep being you.

All patients deserve high-quality treatment which leaves them with security and respect. Only Labour has a plan to invest in the workforce, recruiting 8,500 new staff so that one million additional people can access treatment every year by the end of Labour’s first term in office

The Government need to get a handle on the use of restraint. 

They delayed the implementation of the Use of Force Bill, and in the meantime, instances of restraint have soared. It's the most vulnerable patients that have been left most at risk.

This report is damning for the Government. Yet again, they have failed to meet the needs of people who require early intervention and crisis support in the community.

Patients should be receiving high-quality, person-centred, specialist care. https://t.co/9tUiCz0tLq

When in Ukraine with @MedGlobalOrg, we heard of a family who’d been ambushed by Russian soldiers, leaving children with gunshot wounds.

We just couldn’t leave them behind, so we took them with us to a hospital in Poland.

I promised to share their story:
https://t.co/zbvKoKzOPu

Hospitals and medical facilities across Ukraine are being targeted - doctors are seeking help and supplies.

Civilian vehicles are being targeted and children shot.

This is the reality of what’s happening to people across Ukraine.
https://t.co/y0cDrr1KSr

When in Ukraine, our @MedGlobalOrg team medically evacuated a family from Ukraine to Poland. They had been ambushed by Russian troops in the most horrific way.

I made a promise to a mother that I would share her story. It is heartbreaking. 

Here is her story: https://t.co/x6t8i6GAmX

@ndboulton @BorisJohnson Hi Nick,

Rosena

This is straight out of the Syria playbook, where water supplies and electricity networks were attacked and residential areas were indiscriminately bombed. 

We are seeing this across Kyiv, Kharkiv and Mariupol. It’s frightening.
@AndrewBeatty Precisely

Putin is targeting hospitals and healthcare workers because it prevents the injured from getting treatment and depopulates areas - making them easier to invade.

Doctors I met with in Ukraine shared similar experiences.

@HarrietHarman Thank you Harriet. That’s very kind.

@MedGlobalOrg Thanks to everyone who worked so hard behind the scenes to contribute medical supplies, help with logistics and helped keep us safe. Most of all, thank you to the people of Lviv who were so hospitable and generous in their welcome.

I arrived back home safely from Ukraine yesterday. I went on a humanitarian mission with @MedGlobalOrg who were supporting hospitals to prepare for the darkest days of this conflict.

If the Government are serious about cracking down on illicit Russian money in the UK, they must create a register of overseas property owners. Without this, we can't impose more serious sanctions. Currently, the Government doesn't know where the wealth is hidden.
#PMQs

To stop illicit overseas money making its way into the UK, Companies House needs urgent reform. One example being, there is a flat above a takeaway in the West Country that has hundreds of companies registered at it. The current system just isn't transparent enough.
#PMQs

As @Keir_Starmer said, we must stop Russia Today from broadcasting in the UK - it's Putin's UK propaganda tool. Very frustrating to see the Prime Minister drag his heels on this. 
#PMQs

4,342 children in Tooting live in households that receive Universal Credit.

With inflation set to hit 7.3% in April - and benefits rising by only 3.1% - families will be losing a huge £570 a year.

The Govt need to do more to protect those feeling the pinch in our community.

We can’t keep an eye out on new variants if there’s no testing. These decisions make no scientific sense.

Finally, South Western Railway have listened and will be reinstating some vital services through Earlsfield Station.

However, with short carriage trains and frequent delays, more improvements are still needed.

Read my open letter to SWR here: https://t.co/nvMDpyyNRN

The Prime Minister likes to say there are more people employed now than pre-pandemic.

Since March 2020, we have 1,300 more people claiming unemployment benefits here in Tooting. That's a huge 76% increase.

The Tories are failing people in our community and across the UK.

Without action now, inequalities will only continue to widen.

The next Labour Government would invest in 8,500 more mental health staff to reach 1 million more patients every year, and would put a mental health hub in every community, so young people can seek help securely.

In mental healthcare alone, there are stark inequalities for minority ethnic patients:

- Fewer referrals to IAPT
- More incidences of restraint
- More referrals through social services than GPs

This Tory Government's refusal to recognise that structural racism exists throughout society, has led to deepening health inequalities for ethnic minority groups this past decade.

It should be a badge of shame for this Government. https://t.co/G5yrBK4bLp
Yet again @SarahOwen_ showing how she not only stands up for her community, but for so many across the country. Thank you Sarah. https://t.co/tedYSulDoG

🗓️ Treatment starting within a month.

People he worked with have been attacked by the Taliban - he's fearing for his life.

Another resident is increasingly concerned about their father, who helped the rest of the family flee to safety in Pakistan -  including a brother with cerebral palsy.

Dad is trapped in Kabul and needing urgent help.

One resident, a graduate, is fearful for their mum's safety in Afghanistan. 

Having studied in the UK, and with a brother who assisted the Afghan Govt, the Taliban are now actively looking for the family and have searched their home. His brother and mum are in hiding.

There has been good progress reducing mental health stigma in the sector, however 29% of those surveyed still say they don’t feel comfortable talking about their mental health with others.

The problem is most stark with young tradespeople - 51% of which won't talk mental health. https://t.co/yKbKEspLjP

Mental health issues were more common in certain trades than others. Bricklayers are the most likely to experience problems at 73%.

While other trades such as plasterers report lower rates of problems, they are the most worried about job security at 50%. https://t.co/H0ifMx8lf4

The biggest driver of stress for those surveyed was financial concerns at 38%, followed by tensions with customers.

Women tradespeople were more likely to experience a mental health problem than men, with tensions with business partners one of their main stressors. https://t.co/BQeWXYJP9K

Research from @IronmngryDirect and @MindCharity shows that 49% of tradespeople have experienced a mental health problem due to their job.

Work related stress, anxiety and depression is common throughout the sector with over a quarter experiencing mental health issues every day.

@lottiebarn My concerns were raised with the Council this morning, who say they'll pass it on to the Test and Trace system.

Given this is being run by Test and Trace - I don't understand how it's testing properly or tracing effectively. 

For a service costing the taxpayer tens of billions of pounds - we deserve better.

In addition, as the queues grew bigger, staff handed out tests to people to administer themselves while queuing. Given the PCR tests require a tonsil swab, asking people to do this standing up, without any guidance or a mirror - is shocking. It'll create many invalid tests.
This will lead to positive tests being analysed, without knowing who took them, and no way of contacting people who are positive and potentially carrying the South African variant.

They tried to register the test by calling 119. They had to navigate through 9 different menus on the automated system before speaking to someone.

This system is designed to fail, it will not work, many people simply won't go through this hassle to get their test registered. https://t.co/UdI1dZ8V56

I was alarmed to hear that the system for logging who takes each test is not working, so there is no way of tracing people automatically.

Instead, people are given a barcode, and told to call 119 to register the test themselves.

The automated system needs to be setup. Urgently.

A member of my team took a test this morning.

There were no medical professionals there to assist with the tests, instead, people were given leaflets and ask to do it themselves.

This will create many invalid samples, giving no result.

We need trained professionals on site.

The request for everyone to get a PCR test has only been communicated through Twitter by the Council - so it misses key demographics of people who might be at a higher risk. 

We need letters through every single door. Urgently.

Firstly, Tooting has approximately 105,000 residents, but capacity at the only Tooting PCR testing site is less than 700 a day - which would take us 5 months to test everyone this way. 

This needs to be rapidly scaled up. Urgently.

Because multiple cases of the South African variant have been found in Wandsworth, everyone is asked to get a specific PCR test.

It is being run centrally by the Government's Test and Trace service and it's so appalling, that I fear for its effectiveness.
